I am trying to run the metadata generator on Linux (as part of the build) against a built Windows version of the RCP Agent but am having problems. 

There is currently code in:
  EclipseInstallGeneratorInfoProvider#createLauncherBundleInfo
which automatically adds a dependency to a fragment based on the current OS/WS/ARCH combination.

This causes problems when you try and use the Director on the generated metadata to install a new client on Windows. You get unsatisfied dependency errors.

Here are the errors I get:

 !ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 4 0 2007-08-14 14:55:28.805
 !MESSAGE Application error
 !STACK 1
 java.lang.IllegalStateException: Requirement not satisfied: requiredCapability: org.eclipse.equinox.prov.iunamespace/org.eclipse.equinox.launcher.gtk.linux.x86/0.0.0
     at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewDependencyExpander.collectMatches(NewDependencyExpander.java:174)
     at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewDependencyExpander.algo(NewDependencyExpander.java:305)
     at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewDependencyExpander.expand(NewDependencyExpander.java:107)
     at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.director.NewSimpleDirector.install(NewSimpleDirector.java:65)
Pascal and I have released a fix for this to HEAD.
